articles.description: CES may be virtual this year, but there's no shortage of nifty devices. Here's what we've loved so far.
articles.content: The Lenovo ThinkBook Plus Gen 2 i is another updated dual-display work laptop. It features an E Ink touchscreen display embedded in the lid, so you can check on your work without actually opening the… [+511 chars]

articles.title: Hitman 3 players on Google Stadia will be able to share custom scenarios with just a URL - The Verge
articles.description: Hitman 3 and the World of Assassination trilogy launch on January 20th, and at launch, Google Stadia players will be able to share access to distinct points within a game thanks to Stadia’s State Share feature. The feature works with any campaign or custom mi…
articles.content:
Youll be able to share missions and scenarios from the entire World of Assassination trilogy
A screenshot from Hitman 3.
Image: IO Interactive

articles.author: Cass Marshall
articles.title: Resident Evil Village has a big vampire lady and fans love her - Polygon
articles.description: Resident Evil fans are very excited for the vampire lady in Village. Capcom showed the character off while announcing an upcoming reveal for the horror game. She already has a legion of fans who love her and want her to step on them. She joins Ethan Winters a…
articles.content: We dont know very much about Resident Evil Village, and we wont learn more until the upcoming reveal event on Jan. 21. But we did get a brief glimpse of the new game, and it included a nine foot tall… [+1480 chars]

articles.author: Jon Porter
articles.title: US consumers spent record amounts on video games in 2020, NPD reports - The Verge
articles.description: Spending on video game “hardware, content, and accessories” set a new record of $56.9 billion in 2020 in the US. Spending on hardware hit its highest level in almost a decade at $5.3 billion.
articles.content:
The biggest year for gaming hardware in almost a decade
Photo by James Bareham / The Verge
Spending on video games set a new record of $56.9 billion in 2020 in the US, according to a new NPD Group … [+1753 chars]

articles.title: The hottest products we saw at CES 2021 - CNET
articles.description: Robots, rollable phones and massive OLED TVs were among the best of CES this year.
